company.name: Jubilant Clinsys, Inc.
company.address: One Crossroads Drive, Building A, Second Floor, Bedminster, New Jersey 07921
company.business_description: Jubilant Clinsys, Inc. is a research organization that provides pharmaceutical, biotechnology and medical device companies with services in support of drug and device development.

case_info.legal_authority: Section 5(a) of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 45(a)

complaint.factual_background: Jubilant Clinsys, Inc., a research organization providing services to pharmaceutical and biotech companies, self-certified to the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework in November 2007. In November 2012, the company failed to renew its certification and its status was updated to 'not current' by the Department of Commerce. Despite this lapse, from November 2012 through April 2015, the company continued to display privacy policies on its public website representing that it complied with Safe Harbor principles and annually self-certified with the U.S. Department of Commerce.

representations_made.description: Represented that its policy complies with the U.S. Department of Commerce Safe Harbor framework
representations_made.quoted_text: from countries belonging to the European Union (EU). This policy complies with the U.S. Department of Commerce Safe Harbor framework, which has been approved by the EU as an adequate way for Clinsys to demonstrate that it complies with the

representations_made.description: Represented that it conducts an annual self-assessment to verify the policy conforms to the Safe Harbor Principles
representations_made.quoted_text: Clinsys conducts an annual self-assessment in order to verify that this Policy on Data Protection and Privacy of Personal Information is published and implemented within Clinsys and that it conforms to the Safe Harbor Principles.

representations_made.description: Represented that it self-certifies annually with the U.S. Department of Commerce as a data controller
representations_made.quoted_text: In addition, Clinsys self-certifies annually with the U.S. Department of Commerce as a data controller.

representations_made.description: Represented that it is a current participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework
representations_made.quoted_text: 12. Through the means described in Paragraph 11, respondent has represented, expressly or by implication, that it is a “current” participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework.

counts.title: False Safe Harbor Participation Claims
counts.representation: Respondent represented that it is a 'current' participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework
counts.fact: From November 2012 through April 2015, respondent has not been a 'current' participant in the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework
counts.conclusion: Therefore, the representation set forth in Paragraph 12 is, and was, false and misleading.

definitions.respondent: Jubilant Clinsys, Inc., and its successors and assigns.
definitions.Commerce: as defined in Section 4 of the Federal Trade Commission Act, 15 U.S.C. § 44.

provisions.title: Prohibition Against Misrepresentations About Privacy or Security Programs
provisions.summary: Respondent must not misrepresent its membership in, adherence to, or participation in any privacy or security program, including the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework and U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Framework.

requirements.description: Must not misrepresent membership in, adherence to, compliance with, certification by, endorsement by, or participation in any privacy or security program sponsored by the government or self-regulatory organizations, including Safe Harbor Frameworks
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS ORDERED that respondent and its officers, agents, representatives, and employees, whether acting directly or indirectly, in connection with the advertising, marketing, promotion, offering for sale, or sale of any product or service, in or affecting commerce, shall not misrepresent in any manner, expressly or by implication, the extent to which respondent is a member of, adheres to, complies with, is certified by, is endorsed by, or otherwise participates in any privacy or security program sponsored by the government or any other self-regulatory or standard-setting organization, including, but not limited to, the U.S.-EU Safe Harbor Framework and the U.S.-Swiss Safe Harbor Framework.

provisions.title: Recordkeeping Requirements
provisions.summary: Respondent must maintain and make available to the FTC for five years all documents relating to compliance with the order, including advertisements and documents questioning compliance.

requirements.description: Maintain and make available for inspection all advertisements, promotional materials, and statements containing representations covered by the order, with supporting materials
requirements.quoted_text: A. all advertisements, promotional materials, and any other statements containing any representations covered by this order, with all materials relied upon in disseminating the representation; and

requirements.description: Maintain and make available for inspection any documents that call into question respondent's compliance with the order
requirements.quoted_text: B. any documents, whether prepared by or on behalf of respondent, that call into question respondent’s compliance with this order.

provisions.title: Order Acknowledgment and Dissemination
provisions.summary: Respondent must deliver a copy of the order to current and future personnel with relevant responsibilities and obtain signed acknowledgments of receipt.

requirements.description: Deliver copy of order to all current principals, officers, directors, managers, employees, agents, and representatives with responsibilities relating to the subject matter
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall deliver a copy of this order to all current and future principals, officers, directors, and managers, and to all current and future employees, agents, and representatives having responsibilities relating to the subject matter of

requirements.description: Deliver order to future personnel within 30 days after they assume relevant positions or responsibilities
requirements.quoted_text: after service of this order, and to such future personnel within thirty (30) days after the person assumes such position or responsibilities. For any business entity resulting from any change in

requirements.description: For business entities resulting from structural changes, deliver order at least 10 days prior to the change
requirements.quoted_text: assumes such position or responsibilities. For any business entity resulting from any change in structure set forth in Part IV, delivery shall be at least ten (10) days prior to the change in structure. Respondent must secure a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of this

requirements.description: Secure signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of order from all persons receiving a copy
requirements.quoted_text: structure. Respondent must secure a signed and dated statement acknowledging receipt of this order, within thirty (30) days of delivery, from all persons receiving a copy of the order pursuant to this section.

provisions.title: Notification of Corporate Changes
provisions.summary: Respondent must notify the Commission at least 30 days prior to any corporate changes that may affect compliance obligations, including dissolution, merger, bankruptcy, or name changes.

requirements.description: Notify Commission at least 30 days prior to any change in the corporation that may affect compliance, including dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, creation or dissolution of subsidiaries, bankruptcy filing, or name/address changes
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent shall notify the Commission at least thirty (30) days prior to any change in the corporation(s) that may affect compliance obligations arising under this order, including, but not limited to: a dissolution, assignment, sale, merger, or other action that would result in the emergence of a successor corporation; the creation or dissolution of a subsidiary, parent, or affiliate that engages in any acts or practices subject to this order; the proposed filing of a bankruptcy petition; or a change in the corporate name or address.

requirements.description: If learning of proposed change fewer than 30 days before it occurs, notify Commission as soon as practicable after obtaining such knowledge
requirements.quoted_text: Provided, however, that, with respect to any proposed change in the corporation(s) about which respondent learns fewer than thirty (30) days prior to the date such action is to take place, respondent shall notify the Commission as soon as is practicable after obtaining such knowledge.

provisions.title: Compliance Reporting
provisions.summary: Respondent must file a compliance report with the Commission within 60 days after service of the order and submit additional reports within 10 days upon written notice from the Commission.

requirements.description: File with the Commission a true and accurate written report setting forth in detail the manner and form of compliance with the order
requirements.quoted_text: IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that respondent within sixty (60) days after the date of service of this order, shall file with the Commission a true and accurate report, in writing, setting forth in detail the manner and form of its compliance with this order. Within ten (10) days of

requirements.description: Submit additional true and accurate written report upon receipt of written notice from Commission representative
requirements.quoted_text: forth in detail the manner and form of its compliance with this order. Within ten (10) days of receipt of written notice from a representative of the Commission, it shall submit an additional true and accurate written report.

provisions.title: Order Duration and Termination
provisions.summary: The order will terminate on September 29, 2035, or 20 years from the most recent date a complaint alleging violation is filed in federal court, whichever is later.

requirements.description: Order terminates on September 29, 2035, or 20 years from most recent federal court complaint filing date, whichever is later
requirements.quoted_text: This order will terminate on September 29, 2035, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later; provided, however, that the filing of such a complaint will not affect the duration of:

duration.termination_text: This order will terminate on September 29, 2035, or twenty (20) years from the most recent date that the United States or the Commission files a complaint (with or without an accompanying consent decree) in federal court alleging any violation of the order, whichever comes later
